iseplib.classes

Class PyVariable

  • java.lang.Object
    • iseplib.classes.PyVariable

  • public class PyVariable
extends java.lang.Object
    This class intends to simulate how variables act in Python.
    Version:
    1.0.0 Jan 17, 2020 Note: Any reference to "variable" in this javadoc refers to the PyVariable object.
    Author:
    Barbatos Rex

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String myType
      This String stores the current type the variable is.
      java.lang.String myValue
      This String stores the current value of the variable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PyVariable

        public PyVariable(java.lang.String value,
                  java.lang.String type)
           throws ObjectConstructionFailedException
        Constructor of the class.
        Parameters:
        value - A String to store the value of the PyVariable.
        type - A String to store the type of the variable: Can be "int", "double", "long" and "String".
        Throws:
        ObjectConstructionFailedException - The exception created to throw out in case the construction of the object fails.

        public void status()
            throws ObjectConstructionFailedException
        A simple tool for debugging purposes. It displays the Value and Type of the PyVariable.
        Throws:
